flow.descriptionCdata:
3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.3148ca73-29f5-4eff-8fda-a713ac268f16.description=
Runs a command, allowing you to specify whether it runs locally (no port to be specified), via SSH, Global Shell, ROSH, Telnet, or RSH.

Inputs\:
    host - The host name or IP address.
    port - The port number used to connect to the host.
    username - The user name used to connect.
    password - The password associated with the  input. If using a private key file, this is the passphrase for the file.
    protocol - The protocol used to run the command. 
Examples\: SSH, ROSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, REXEC, local, WMI, NASConnectTelnet, HPOM
    timeout - The time to wait for the command to complete (in milliseconds). Increase this value if you are getting incomplete output results or a timeout.
Default value\: 90000
    command - The command to run.
    arguments - The arguments to pass to the command.
    environment - Specifies the environment variables and values that need to be defined when running the command.
    startDir - The path to the starting directory.
    pty - Specifies whether to use pty (used by SSH, GlobalShell)
Valid values\: true, false
    privateKeyFile - The path to the private key file, relative to ICONCLUDE_HOME on the RAS host (used by SSH, GlobalShell).
    sasHost - The host on which to run the ROSH command.
    sasHostUsername - The user name used to run the ROSH command on .
    usernamePrompt - The prompt message for the user name. Used by the Telnet protocol. When used by the NASConnectTelnet protocol, the default value is 'NAS Login\:'.
    passwordPrompt - The prompt message for the password associated with the < usernamePrompt > input. Used by the Telnet protocol.  When used by the 'NASConnectTelnet' protocol, the default value is 'Password\:'
    outputPath - The network accessible path where to store the temporary files. If you do not specify this input, it points to '\\host\admin$\temp\'. If this path is not accessible, change it to use another share to which the host local system account has write access. By default, the path needs to be changed on Windows 2000 systems.
    nasDevice - The NAS device on which to run the command when using the 'NASConnect' protocol.
    nasDeviceConsoleMode - The NAS device console mode used to run the command scripts running the command on the specified NAS device. If you leave this input empty, command scripts are not used, and the connections to the NAS device and the command are issued directly in the console. This is not recommended. Due to error handling capabilities limitation, the result might be a success even if the command failed to run. You can find the values for this input in the NAS web interface, as a drop-down list when creating a new command script (for example, Cisco IOS enable).
    hpomNode - The node on which to run the command.
    hpomProtocol - The protocol used to communicate with HPOM (HTTP or HTTPS).
    characterSet - The name of the character set used for stream encoding and decoding between the RAS and target machine.
Default value\: UTF-8 (used by SSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, REXEC)
Examples\: SJIS,EUC-JP, UTF-8

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. Used to determine the operation response, specifying whether the operation is successful or not.
    stdOut - The standard output (STDOUT) of the command.
    stdErr - The standard error (STDERR) of the command.

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Notes\:
Telnet protocol - Since telnet is shell protocol, not a remote execution protocol, the response is always  successful if the command is ran in the remote shell.  The return code of the specified command cannot be determined in this protocol.  If you must use the telnet protocol with this operation, make sure to check the command results. Consider using the SSH or REXEC protocol instead.
3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.36880e0d-1476-49f1-b299-b3a0b92ffe2e.prompt=Enter value for Service Manager Incident ID 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.38ec5e7f-3e94-4fd3-8b40-276ff4971358.prompt=Enter value for Admin User Name 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.438c0904-055d-4130-9aaf-8de60364e31f.prompt=Use Random Password? 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.4d31329c-9610-489d-abe5-a8e7bceeb0b4.prompt=Enter value for Admin Password 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.55c56c4a-9073-41e0-a0ab-2ccf423de173.prompt=Escalated 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.569a1a70-2b11-423f-9902-42f43ad3aa62.callout=Updates the Incident if Reset Local User Password fails with the error message. 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.5c0e0d6b-6eed-4ea9-9a92-f5ad958e67ce.prompt=Enter value for host 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.60b4e4f4-c43c-4fc6-b6d4-f56cbde9c153.description=
Generates a random password.

Inputs\:
passwordLength - the required length of the password
numberOfNonAlphanumericCharacters - the minimum number of non alphanumeric numbers

Responses\:
success - password generated
failure - failed to generate password

Extra Results\:
password - the generated password

NOTE\:
If passwordLength or numberOfNonAlphanumericCharacters are less than 0 or if numberOfNonAlphanumericCharacters is greater than passwordLength  the operation will succeed  and will return an empty password.
3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.643bfc6f-c920-479c-98e7-aeec867fd1e4.callout=Checks whether an Incident exists in Service Manager and has status open. 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.669929cf-587c-43ef-8767-1662d9f2de60.prompt=Major Incident 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.7978be61-b594-422d-8a84-593c22c569d5.prompt=Select value for Service Manager Version 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.7b337892-7e23-4b9b-89d2-a06fc08df1b6.prompt=Enter value for Service Manager Host 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.8729ef21-c581-4f78-a0be-bf71779e78fc.prompt=Enter value for Service Manager User Name 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.894d1a4d-f0f8-43ab-93a3-00ee2f10f28a.callout=Resets local user password. 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.8c3520e6-f4a9-448f-8f26-20bb588a3988.prompt=Enter value for Service Manager Password 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.966687bc-2f49-4464-9b96-26ab89acd18c.description=
Allows a user to select how they should be notified of the outcome of a flow, and shows them a message in that way.

Inputs\:
notifyData -  The text of the notification message.
notifyMethod - The method of notification (Write to File, Email, Display or None). This value is case-insensitive.
subject - A description of what the notification is about. 
destination - The destination of the notification (email address or filename). This field is required when notifyMethod is Email or Write to File.
notificationServer - The email server to send the notification through. This field is required when notifyMethod is Email.
from - The originator of the message (email "from" address).This field is required when notifyMethod is Email.
serverPort - The port the service to notify on the server is running on. This field used when notifyMethod is Email, and it is optional (it defaults to 25 if not specified).
htmlEmail - Default value is true. The value should be true if the email is in rich text/html format. The value should be false to send the email in plain text format.

Responses\:
success - The user was notified.
failure - Notification failed.

As mentioned above, some inputs are required for certain types of notification methods. In order to schedule a flow that in turn uses this flow, all of the required fields for the given notification method must be supplied, or else the flow will not be able to execute to completion. For example, if "notifyMethod" is "File", then the "destination" input must also be specified.
3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.984a2305-bda9-4d09-9959-69ceeb18dd74.callout=Checks whether user is local user or domain user. 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.ad438395-7dac-4b89-a0be-dcbc677f238f.callout=Notifies user if password was reset. 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.ad71e793-717c-40a7-ab03-29ce1313109b.callout=Checks whether to generate a random password or not. 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.b592e450-8ce5-4acb-82c2-75a67cc3ab75.callout=Updates the Incident if Reset Domain User Password fails with the error message. 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.bce6c897-56cf-4eeb-893b-2a5b1d14a97b.description=
Updates values of an incident ticket.

Inputs\:
    host - The DNS name or IP Address of your Service Manager host.
    port - The port to connect to your Service Manager host on.
    protocol - The protocol to connect to your Service Manager host with.
Valid values\: HTTP, HTTPS.
    username - The username for the Service Manager host.
    password - The password for the Service Manager user.
    smVersion - The Service Manager version.
Valid values\: sm930, sm920
Default value\: sm930
    alertStatus - Alert status.
    assignee - Assignee of ticket.
    assignmentGroup - Assignment group of the ticket. 
    briefDescription - The incident ticket title.
    category - Ticket category.
    closedBy - Ticket closer. 
    closureCode - Ticket closure code. 
    configItem - The affected CI of the ticket.
    contact - Contact for the ticket.  Not visible to user in the default view of an incident in SM 9.X.
    description - Ticket description.
    id - ID of the ticket.
    initialImpact - The Impact of the ticket. 
Example\: 1,2,3
    journalUpdates - Update history (new-line delimited).
    openedBy - Ticket opener.  
    problemType - Problem type. Not visible to user in the default view of an incident in SM 9.X.
    productType - The Subarea of the ticket.
    resolution - Ticket solution information.
    resolutionFixType - Fix method for the ticket. Not visible to user in the default view of an incident.
Valid values\: permanent, temporary.
    service - Affected service with ticket. 
    severity - Ticket urgency.
    siteCategory - Site category.
    slaAgreementID - SLA Agreement ID. Not visible to user in the default view of an incident.
    solution - Ticket solution.
    subCategory - Ticket area.
    ticketOwner - Ticket owner.
    updatedBy - Username of last updater.

Results\:
    smMessage - Service Manager request brief message
    smMessages - Service manager request additional messages
    smReturnCode - Service Manager request's return code
    smStatus - Service Manager request return status

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed successfully.
    failure - Something went wrong.
3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.c36dbef0-5923-407f-bb8e-b0e8bf36386f.prompt=Select value for Service Manager Protocol 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.c9935693-1344-405c-88f9-cbaecd5d0d0d.callout=This flow resets the password of a Windows user, either locally or inside a domain. The action ends with a notification. 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.ca368435-2924-4577-9d8f-ee89a5d600f9.description=
Checks to see if a string matches another string using a specific rule. Input toMatch is the actual string to check to see if it matches the matchTo expression.

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string to check if matches another string.
    matchTo - The string to match against. 
Examples\: If the matchType is RegEx, the input matchTo is the regular expression like \: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Boolean value for whether or not to ignore case during match.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Responses\:
    success - The String matched.
    failure - The string did not match, or something went wrong.
3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.cd0db315-1b3e-46a3-a718-61c92aca5fb8.description=
Resolves an incident ticket

Inputs\:
    host - The DNS name or IP Address of your Service Manager host
    port - The port to connect to your Service Manager host on.
    protocol - The protocol to connect to your Service Manager host with.
Valid values\: HTTP, HTTPS
    username - The username for the Service Manager host.
    password - The password for the Service Manager user.
    smVersion - The Service Manager version.
Valid values\: sm930, sm920
Default value\: sm930
    id - ID of the ticket.
    resolve - Resolve ticket? If the provided value is not "true" or "yes", then reject.
    solution - Ticket solution
    resolutionFixType - Fix method for the ticket.

Results\:
    smMessage - Service Manager request brief message
    smMessages - Service manager request additional messages
    smReturnCode - Service Manager request's return code
    smStatus - Service Manager request return status

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed successfully.
    failure - Something went wrong.
3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.d0f68432-f803-4fbb-b09a-c3283abb1663.description=
Updates values of an incident ticket.

Inputs\:
    host - The DNS name or IP Address of your Service Manager host.
    port - The port to connect to your Service Manager host on.
    protocol - The protocol to connect to your Service Manager host with.
Valid values\: HTTP, HTTPS.
    username - The username for the Service Manager host.
    password - The password for the Service Manager user.
    smVersion - The Service Manager version.
Valid values\: sm930, sm920
Default value\: sm930
    alertStatus - Alert status.
    assignee - Assignee of ticket.
    assignmentGroup - Assignment group of the ticket. 
    briefDescription - The incident ticket title.
    category - Ticket category.
    closedBy - Ticket closer. 
    closureCode - Ticket closure code. 
    configItem - The affected CI of the ticket.
    contact - Contact for the ticket.  Not visible to user in the default view of an incident in SM 9.X.
    description - Ticket description.
    id - ID of the ticket.
    initialImpact - The Impact of the ticket. 
Example\: 1,2,3
    journalUpdates - Update history (new-line delimited).
    openedBy - Ticket opener.  
    problemType - Problem type. Not visible to user in the default view of an incident in SM 9.X.
    productType - The Subarea of the ticket.
    resolution - Ticket solution information.
    resolutionFixType - Fix method for the ticket. Not visible to user in the default view of an incident.
Valid values\: permanent, temporary.
    service - Affected service with ticket. 
    severity - Ticket urgency.
    siteCategory - Site category.
    slaAgreementID - SLA Agreement ID. Not visible to user in the default view of an incident.
    solution - Ticket solution.
    subCategory - Ticket area.
    ticketOwner - Ticket owner.
    updatedBy - Username of last updater.

Results\:
    smMessage - Service Manager request brief message
    smMessages - Service manager request additional messages
    smReturnCode - Service Manager request's return code
    smStatus - Service Manager request return status

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed successfully.
    failure - Something went wrong.
3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.d37f910c-334a-4d41-b1e1-bff8beee39b6.callout=Generates a random password. 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.dd7d8f87-0a88-4a41-a7d1-05baa697c76e.prompt=Enter value for Service Manager Port 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.description=
Changes the password of windows user for a valid incident from Service Manager, notifies and resolves the incident. This can be used to change the password either for a local windows user or a domain user. For domain users, after changing the password the user is forced to change his password again at first log in.
The flow allows the user to enter the new password manually or to let the flow generate a random one. If the flow randomly generates the new password, it will try three times to generate the password according to the password policies from the target machine. If it fails three times consecutively to generate a valid password, the flow will fail, asking the user to manually enter a password that matches the password policies.

Inputs\:
    host - If you want to change the password of a local user, this should be the target windows machine on which the local user exists. If you want to change the password of a domain user, this should be the domain controller that manages the accounts.
    adminUsername - The user with administrator privileges on the host. If using a domain controller, the full username can be specified, including the domain.
Example\: Administrator, userWitAdimPriviledges@domain, domain\userWithAdminPriviledges
    adminPassword - The password of the user with administrator privileges.
    domain - The domain of the user. This is a HIDDEN input. If you want to change the password of a domain user and did not include the domain in the adminUsername you have to set it here.
    targetedUsername - The user for which the password has to be changed. For Active Directory users this should be the sAMAccountName. This is a HIDDEN input.
    useRandomPassword - Specifies if the password will be randomly generated, or will be provided as input.
Valid Values\: true, false
Default Value\: true
    randomPasswordLength - If randomPassword is true, this input specifies the length of the password to be generated.
Default Value\: 8
    newPassword - The new password for the specified user. This needs to be provided only if randmPassword is set to false.
    emailTo - The destination of the notification (email address). 
    emailServer - The email server to send the notification through. 
    emailFrom - The originator of the message (email "from" address).
    emailPort - The port on which smtp service is listening.
Default Value\: 25
    smHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your Service Manager host.
    smPort - The port to connect to your Service Manager host on.
    smProtocol - The protocol to connect to your Service Manager host with.
Valid values\: HTTP, HTTPS.
    smUsername - The username for the Service Manager host.
    smPassword - The password for the Service Manager user.	
    smVersion - The Service Manager version.
Valid values\: sm930, sm920
Default value\: sm930
    incidentId - ID of the incident.
    ticketOwner - Ticket owner. 
	
Responses\:
    success - The flow completed successfully and the password has been changed.
    failure - The flow has failed to change the password or an invalid incident was provided.
	
Note\:
    1. An incident is valid if it exists in Service Manager and has Open status.
    2. The ticket owner input is used to assign a ticket for manual processing in case the automation fails for some reason.
    3. The domain and targetedUsername inputs are HIDDEN. In order to use them you will have to add the as flow inputs by using the 'Add Inpust' button from Inputs tab.
    4. In order to read the domain or targetedUsername from Service Manager they have to be set in the Incident description using the following format\: the 'domain' or 'targetedUsername' string followed by any character and none to many whitespace characters, the domain or username followed by at least one whitespace character. 
Example\: domain\:test ,  domain\=    test , targetedUsername\: administrator .
3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.e97af4c7-7c93-472a-9b58-29c339b0bdad.callout=Resolves an Incident if password was reset. 3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.f4a6d7bf-1229-4f63-b0cd-3ea5bcfa9834.description=
Checks to see if a string matches another string using a specific rule. Input toMatch is the actual string to check to see if it matches the matchTo expression.

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string to check if matches another string.
    matchTo - The string to match against. 
Examples\: If the matchType is RegEx, the input matchTo is the regular expression like \: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Boolean value for whether or not to ignore case during match.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Responses\:
    success - The String matched.
    failure - The string did not match, or something went wrong.
3ed79afc-7974-465e-b022-aaaafd0a5299.fa0e4f10-e873-4aa5-b067-0913f21b4522.callout=Resets domain user password.
flow.name: Reset User Password Extended

scriptlet.name: default
default
default

staticBinding.value:
Hello,

Message: Password successfully reset for the following account: ${targetedUsername} on ${host}
New Password: ${newPassword}

Thank you,
HPE Operations Orchestration

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Please do not reply to this email as it was automatically generated. For more information contact your administrator.

scriptlet.name: default
default
Step Reset Local User Password in Flow Reset User Password Extended (02980f30-f980-48dd-97bd-c0346d4ee83d)
default
Step Use Random Password? in Flow Reset User Password Extended (b9fa2261-2d46-42ac-a2c1-405ebb3ebb07)
